result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roosevelt Walker

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Roosevelt Walker in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Upon motion of the state, case dismissed and read in for sentencing in 15CF1437

Defendant Roosevelt Walker in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Student Intern Morgan Wilz under the supervision of  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Statements by defense counsel that defendant has a pending case set for plea hearing in Branch 38. Court will allow this case to be transferred to Branch 38 if Judge Wagner is willing to accept jurisdiction.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 38.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Roosevelt Walker in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for status of counsel.  Statements by defense counsel that defendat has a pending case and there is a possible global resolution.  Defense requests a status conference date.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 45.  Status conference scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Roosevelt Walker in court.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for pretrial conference.  Defendant has not yet contacted the Public Defender's Office.  Court orders defendant to inform PD's office of next court date.  Case adjourned to Branch 46.  Status conference scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Tyra W. and Angela G, and their residence.

Defendant Roosevelt Walker in court.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. 
Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 46.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 5/11/15 @ 1:30pm
